programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: `Dumb Dora was so dumb that...' is a typical lead-in to `fill-in-the-blank'-style queries asked of contestants seeking to match celebrities' answers. This game show had several incarnations on network TV and in syndication, but throughout it was noted for the double-entendre humor and in-joking byplay among its celebrity panelists, including Charles Nelson Reilly and Richard Dawson (in a stint that launched his kissy-kissy `Family Feud' career). programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady visits Battersea Dogs and Cats Home to help give the residents a fabulous festive season, and hopes to find loving homes for all the dogs in time for Christmas Day. At the top of his wish list is to find new homes for parson's terrier Peppermint Patty, who was handed in with a massive lump on her neck, and bichon frise Phyllis, who is the suspected victim of back-street breeding. Another dog Paul is keeping a close eye on is feisty 2-year-old chihuahua Billo. This small dog with a big personality has been born with back-to-front kneecaps, so Paul is determined to get Billo back on his feet again in time for Christmas. Other dogs that Paul meets include lurcher Gracie, suffering from one of the worst cases of mange ever seen at Battersea, and bull mastiff Cookie, who is desperate for company and affection. Finally there is cute puppy Bruno, who steals the hearts of everyone at Battersea(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady visits Battersea Dogs and Cats Home to help give the residents a fabulous festive season, and hopes to find loving homes for all the dogs in time for Christmas Day. At the top of his wish list is to find new homes for parson's terrier Peppermint Patty, who was handed in with a massive lump on her neck, and bichon frise Phyllis, who is the suspected victim of back-street breeding. Another dog Paul is keeping a close eye on is feisty 2-year-old chihuahua Billo. This small dog with a big personality has been born with back-to-front kneecaps, so Paul is determined to get Billo back on his feet again in time for Christmas. Other dogs that Paul meets include lurcher Gracie, suffering from one of the worst cases of mange ever seen at Battersea, and bull mastiff Cookie, who is desperate for company and affection. Finally there is cute puppy Bruno, who steals the hearts of everyone at Battersea(n)
